intro: Krenakia cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban krenakia, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
